0.title: Dalits, Adivasis, Muslims face discrimination in jobs: Oxfam India
0.article_body: Dalits, Adivasis and Muslims in the country face discrimination when it comes to employment, a report by NGO Oxfam India showed. Titled 'India Discrimination Report 2022', the report said that SC/ST people and Muslims earn less than those not belonging to the groups respectively. "The lower employment for urban Muslims attributes 68% to discrimination," said the report.

1.title: Anahita, who was in car with Mistry, operated for pelvic reconstruction; UK doctor flown in
1.article_body: Dr Anahita Pandole was operated for pelvic reconstruction at a Mumbai hospital after she and her husband Darius Pandole were injured in a car crash that killed former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry. Notably, Dr Peter V Giannoudis, Chairman of Academic Department of Trauma and Orthopedics Surgery at University of Leeds, UK, was flown to Mumbai for his expert advice.

2.title: When we don't let audience down, they applaud: Pooja on 'Brahmastra' success
2.article_body: Commenting on the success of 'Brahmastra: Part One Shiva', Pooja Bhatt said the hate against it existed only on social media. She said she experienced the audience being entertained and "responding completely" to the film in a theatre. "When we let them down, they let us know. When we don't, they applaud and give us so much love," she added.

3.title: Symbols of pure evil: Goa Forward Party chief after 8 Goa Cong MLAs join BJP
3.article_body: After eight Goa Congress MLAs joined BJP on Wednesday, Goa Forward Party chief Vijai Sardesai said that they stand as the "symbols of pure evil". "The eight legislators who have decided…to pursue their greed for wealth and hunger for power, stand today as symbols of pure evil, displaying their shameless selfishness…in defiance of Almighty God," he added.

4.title: Pune's PCMC sends seizure warnings to 31,971 property tax defaulters
4.article_body: Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) sent seizure warnings to as many as 31,971 property tax defaulters, officials said. It warned them of confiscating their properties if they don't pay their dues. As many as 3,850 property owners have so far not paid even one rupee in tax, officials added. "Action against tax defaulters...in three stages," a PCMC official said.

5.title: Fitch cuts India's growth forecast for 2022-23 to 7% from 7.8%
5.article_body: Fitch Ratings has cut India's growth forecast for the current financial year to 7% from the previous estimate of 7.8%. It further cut its GDP growth forecast for the next fiscal year to 6.7% from the earlier estimate of 7.4%. The rating agency's growth estimate for FY23 is lower than the Reserve Bank of India's forecast of 7.2%.

6.title: Harsha Engineers IPO fully subscribed on Day 1, bought 5.08 times on Day 2
6.article_body: Harsha Engineers International's IPO was fully subscribed on the first day with 1.92 times the subscription on Wednesday. On the second day of bidding on Thursday, investors bought 8.55 crore equity shares against an offer size of 1.68 crore, which is 5.08 times the subscription. The IPO is worth ₹755 crore comprising fresh issue and offer-for-sale part.

7.title: Woman carrying skull-less foetus forced to travel 2,250 km to terminate pregnancy in US
7.article_body: A pregnant woman carrying a skull-less foetus that had no chance of survival was forced to travel over 2,250 kilometres to New York for an abortion after she was refused care in Louisiana, her home state. Nancy Davis said she was denied an abortion because of confusion around Louisiana's anti-abortion law introduced after US Supreme Court overturned Roe v Wade.

8.title: 17 people fined for not wearing rear seat belts in Delhi
8.article_body: The Delhi Traffic Police on Wednesday issued challans to 17 people for not wearing seat belts in the backseat of vehicles. The drive was carried out on Barakhamba Road between 11 am and 1 pm, Deputy Commissioner of Police (Traffic) Aalap Patel said. As per the Motor Vehicles Act, passengers not wearing rear seat belts can be fined upto ₹1,000.

9.title: Tamilnad Mercantile Bank makes market debut at 2.9% discount
9.article_body: Tamilnad Mercantile Bank made its market debut on Thursday at a discount of 2.94% to the issue price. The stock was listed at ₹510 apiece on the BSE and at ₹495 on the NSE against the issue price of ₹510 apiece. Its IPO had seen 2.86 times the subscription during September 5-7 and it has mobilised ₹831.6 crore.

10.title: Man tags Aviation Ministry to complain about 'unfair' iPad pricing, ministry replies
10.article_body: A Twitter user, while sharing a screenshot of an iPad pricing, tagged the Ministry of Civil Aviation instead of the Ministry of Consumer Affairs and wrote, "iPad Pro 11-inch was never of ₹1,76,900. @MoCA_GoI please take action for unfair trade practices." Meanwhile, the ministry replied to him, "We intend to help, but we're busy providing affordable air travel to India."

11.title: UP govt suspends official over order to include Urdu in nameplates at health centres
11.article_body: Yogi Adityanath-led Uttar Pradesh government has suspended Joint Director (Health), Dr Tabassum Khan, over a September 1 order directing all district health centres to include signboards and nameplates also in Urdu. The government said it has found Dr Khan "prima facie" guilty of "grave indiscipline" by issuing the order "on her own without getting it approved from the appropriate level".

12.title: Why don't we criticise 'Avengers' or 'Iron Man': Actor on Brahmastra's plot
12.article_body: 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva' actor Saqib Ayub has defended the film's plot and said it is similar to any superhero movie. Stating examples of 'Avengers', 'Thor' and 'Iron Man', Saqib questioned why these films are not criticised when even they have the same story. "Brahmastra has a different theme and different powers, so the narrative is different," he said.

13.title: Virat Kohli might take retirement after 2022 T20 World Cup: Shoaib Akhtar
13.article_body: After ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi's retirement advice to Virat Kohli, former pacer Shoaib Akhtar has predicted that Kohli might retire from T20Is after the upcoming World Cup in Australia to extend his "longevity in the other formats". "If I [were] him, I would have looked at the larger picture and taken a call," stated Akhtar.

14.title: On Hindi Diwas, Karnataka CM promises law to make Kannada mandatory
14.article_body: Amid protests over celebration of Hindi Diwas on Wednesday, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said his government will bring a law to make Kannada mandatory in the state. The statement came after former CM HD Kumaraswamy staged a protest against Hindi imposition during the Assembly session. "There is no compromise when it comes to protecting the interests of Karnataka," said Bommai.

15.title: Delhi Excise Dept exploring ways to dispose of 70 Lakh unsold liquor bottles
15.article_body: The Delhi government's excise department is exploring ways to dispose of 70 lakh bottles of leftover liquor and roll them over for sale under the current excise regime, officials said. They further said that the stock, also comprising wine and beer, is stored at warehouses as it could not be sold under Excise Policy 2021-22 which ended on August 31.

16.title: Chris Hemsworth has incredible comedic talent: Natalie Portman
16.article_body: Natalie Portman said her 'Thor: Love and Thunder' co-star Chris Hemsworth has an "incredible comedic talent" and "a quick brain" for reacting creatively and coming up with new ideas. Calling his commitment to work "impressive to watch", Natalie said she often has to remind herself that she has to act in a scene and "can't just be an audience".

17.title: Armenia, Azerbaijan agree on ceasefire after deadly clashes
17.article_body: Armenia and Azerbaijan have reached a ceasefire following two days of fighting that has killed 155 soldiers from both sides, an Armenian official said. The ceasefire came into effect from 8 pm local time on Wednesday, Armen Grigoryan, Armenia's Security Council's Secretary, added. The recent fighting between the countries is the worst since 2020 war over the disputed Nagorno-Karabakh region.

18.title: 2 minor Dalit sisters raped and murdered in UP, bodies found hanging on tree; 6 arrested
18.article_body: The bodies of two Dalit sisters, aged 15 and 17, were found hanging from a tree in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri on Wednesday. Six accused named Chotu, Junaid, Sohail, Hafizul, Karimuddin and Arif were arrested. Police said Sohail and Junaid raped them and after the girls demanded that the accused marry them, Sohail, Hafizul and Junaid strangulated and killed them.

19.title: Pak actress criticised for throwing plastic in river, says 'COVID has affected my brain'
19.article_body: After she was criticised for throwing plastic bags in a river, Pakistani actress Resham said that it happened because COVID-19 has affected her brain twice. "I have had COVID-19 twice and its effects are still there. This is why I did not realise what I was going to do and threw the bags in recklessness," she added.

20.title: 2 acquitted from charges of rioting, torching house in 2020 Delhi riots
20.article_body: A court acquitted two persons from charges of rioting and torching a house during 2020 Delhi riots. "Prosecution hasn't been able to prove its case...beyond reasonable doubt which is the touchstone of criminal law," it said. "On the cumulative reading of the entire testimonies...presence of accused in the unlawful assembly...participation in the act of rioting...not established at all," it added.

21.title: All mosques should be moved away from temples: UP minister
21.article_body: UP Cabinet Minister Sanjay Nishad on Wednesday said that all mosques that are in close proximity to temples should be voluntarily shifted away. He said that just as what happened in the case of Ram Mandir, mosques near every temple should be removed. He added that "we" don't need to move, others can rather construct their place of worship elsewhere.

22.title: Mumbai to witness heavy rainfall in next 48 hours: IMD
22.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted that Mumbai and its suburbs will receive moderate to heavy rainfall in the next 48 hours. The weather agency has issued an orange alert for Mumbai today. According to the IMD, the temperature in the city is expected to hover around 25 degrees Celsius to 30 degrees Celsius over the next two days.

23.title: Encroachment of nullahs main reason for flooding in Pune: PMC report
23.article_body: A Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) site report has revealed that most areas in the city got flooded due to illegal encroachment of nullahs. Following the report, the additional municipal commissioner instructed the building permission department to file a report on how permissions were granted for such constructions. This comes after several areas in Pune got flooded following rainfall on Sunday.

24.title: Who is Yvon Chouinard, the billionaire donating his company to fight climate crisis?
24.article_body: American billionaire Yvon Chouinard, the Founder of fashion retailer Patagonia, has donated his $3 billion-company to fight the climate crisis. Chouinard, a former rock climber, has an estimated net worth of $1.2 billion and has long championed environmental causes. Previously, he said that he didn't want to become a businessman and reportedly doesn't own a computer or a mobile phone.

25.title: Was nervous going back on set for 'Made In Heaven 2': Neelam Kothari
25.article_body: Neelam Kothari Soni has said she was nervous about going on sets for 'Made In Heaven 2'. "It was like, 'OMG I'm actually back in front of the camera'," she said. Neelam said she was "grateful" to have her husband Samir Soni on the sets. She added it was "great fun" to shoot with him and Sanjay Kapoor.

26.title: BJP, RSS spreading violence contrary to teachings of social reformers: Rahul
26.article_body: Congress' Rahul Gandhi said BJP and RSS are spreading violence, hatred and anger in country, which is contrary to teachings of renowned social reformers. He added that social reformers like Sree Narayana Guru, Ayyankali and Chattampi Swamikal didn't preach violence. "The BJP and RSS ideology is one of hatred and anger which [is] dividing and weakening the country," he stated.

27.title: Well played, loved calling your graceful batting: Bhogle on Uthappa's retirement
27.article_body: Reacting to cricketer Robin Uthappa announcing his retirement from all forms of Indian cricket, commentator Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "Well played Uthappa. Loved calling your graceful batting. You have had such an eventful career and you gave a lot of joy." Bhogle added, "Gambhir and Uthappa will always be one of the best combinations in the IPL."

28.title: Projects don't go out of hand in 1-2 months: Maha CM on Vedanta project
28.article_body: After Opposition party leaders criticised Eknath Shinde-led Maharashtra government after Vedanta-Foxconn project was shifted to Gujarat, Maharashtra CM said that such projects don't go out of hand in one or two months. "The company had already made up its mind and may have thought the [previous MVA] government would not help. They didn't know the government would change," he added.

29.title: No efforts must be made to make India 'Hindia': TN CM Stalin
29.article_body: Reacting to Union Minister Amit Shah's comment on Hindi language, Tamil Nadu CM on Wednesday said all Indian languages day should be celebrated rather than just Hindi Diwas. "India is known for its integrity...there must not be any efforts aimed at dividing country in name of 'Hindia'...[Amit] Shah's Hindi pitch went against country's ideal of unity in diversity," he added.

30.title: Data engineering firm Sigmoid raises $12 mn from Sequoia Capital
30.article_body: Data engineering startup Sigmoid has raised $12 million in a Series B financing round from Sequoia Capital India. Sequoia has invested $19.3 million into Sigmoid till now. Sigmoid was founded by Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) alumni Lokesh Anand, Mayur Rustagi and Rahul Singh in 2013 and provides analytics and AI solutions to firms across the world.

31.title: Jharkhand raises OBC reservation in state government jobs to 27% from 14%
31.article_body: Hemant Soren-led Jharkhand government raised the OBC reservation in the state government jobs to 27% from 14%. The cabinet approved a proposal granting 77% reservation in state government jobs for the members of the SC, ST, backward classes, OBC and economically weaker sections. Jharkhand cabinet also gave its nod to use the 1932 land records to determine local inhabitants.

32.title: Photo with 'private parts' visible morphed, not part of nude shoot: Ranveer Singh to police
32.article_body: Ranveer Singh has told Mumbai Police that one of the photos, based on which an FIR was registered against him on charges of obscenity, was morphed. An officer said that Ranveer claimed in his statement that the photograph, in which the complainant had alleged his 'private parts were visible', was morphed and not part of the photoshoot for Paper magazine.

33.title: Putin doesn't believe Ukraine invasion a mistake: German Chancellor
33.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin "unfortunately" doesn't think he committed a "mistake" by invading Ukraine, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said on Wednesday. Scholz made these comments after he had a 90-minute-long telephonic conversation with the Russian leader on Tuesday. The exit of Russian troops from Ukraine was the only way for "peace to have a chance in the region", he added.

34.title: CM KCR's family has a role in Delhi liquor scam: T'gana BJP chief
34.article_body: Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar claimed that CM K Chandrashekar Rao has a role in the alleged Delhi liquor scam. "[KCR's] family has a role in all scams including land, sand and liquor," Sanjay said, alleging that the Chief Minister asked for bribes to provide houses to poor people. "After...BJP government comes, we'll build houses for all," Sanjay added.

35.title: Won't be surprised if BJP gives Mumbai to Guj: Patole on Vedanta project
35.article_body: Congress' Nana Patole criticised Maharashtra BJP leaders over Vedanta group choosing Gujarat to start a semiconductor unit. "Maharashtra BJP leaders are looting the state...giving it to Gujarat to get blessings of their leaders in Delhi. The company that went would've made over ₹1 lakh crore of investment. It won't be surprising if they give even Mumbai to Gujarat," Patole added.

36.title: Pune civic body plans to set up hydropower project at Bund Garden
36.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is planning to set up a hydropower project at Bund Garden. It has identified a site for the project on the Mula-Mutha river. "We aim to generate 300 kW energy every year," said a PMC official. Experts estimate that the installation cost would be recovered within six to seven years of completion of the project.

37.title: SBI hikes Benchmark Prime Lending Rate by 70 bps to 13.45% from today
37.article_body: SBI has raised the Benchmark Prime Lending Rate (BPLR) by 70 basis points or 0.7% to 13.45% effective from Thursday, September 15. This would make loan repayment linked to BPLR costlier. Earlier in August, SBI raised its benchmark lending rates by up to 50 basis points or 0.5%. The bank also raised the Base Rate to 8.7%, effective Thursday.

38.title: SL shouldn't be looking at anything other than winning T20 WC: Jayawardena
38.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka captain Mahela Jayawardena has said the Dasun Shanaka-led side shouldn't be looking at anything other than winning the T20 World Cup in Australia. "That's the attitude to have and this is a group I feel that they will play with no fear," added Jayawardena. Sri Lanka recently won the Asia Cup 2022 after defeating Pakistan in the final.

39.title: Lived here for years, evicted in mins: B'luru residents affected by demolition
39.article_body: As BBMP is carrying out a demolition drive in several areas of Bengaluru to remove illegal structures after the flood water receded, residents affected by demolition shared their experiences. A resident, whose house was demolished in Munnekolala, said that they have been living there for 10 years and suddenly they were asked to vacate the home in five minutes.

40.title: India reports 6,422 new COVID-19 cases, daily positivity rate stands at 2.04%
40.article_body: India reported 6,422 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Health Ministry. This comes a day after the country recorded 5,108 fresh COVID-19 cases. Following 5,748 recoveries in the last 24 hours, the active cases in the country now stand at 46,389. The daily positivity rate currently stands at 2.04%.

41.title: I have not returned empty-handed from India: Bangladesh PM Hasina
41.article_body: Bangladeshi PM Sheikh Hasina on Wednesday said that her recent four-day visit to India benefitted Bangladesh. "They [India] have shown much sincerity and I haven't returned empty-handed...I think...my visit...has opened a new horizon in Bangladesh-India relations," she added. During Hasina's visit, India and Bangladesh signed seven agreements, including one on sharing of waters of Kushiyara river.

42.title: Helping 2000+ professionals in switching to Data Science career: Scaler
42.article_body: Scaler shared that its Data Science and ML with Analytics program is helping 2000+ working professionals switch their career to data science. With a chance to learn hands-on with 80+ business case studies, more working professionals are choosing this online course without quitting jobs, said Scaler. Scaler's Free Live Class is the best place to start your transition, it stated.

43.title: 7-yr-old kidnapped girl rescued within 2 hrs in Delhi, accused arrested
43.article_body: A Delhi Police constable rescued a seven-year-old girl and arrested a 22-year-old man who had kidnapped her from east Delhi. The girl was kidnapped on September 11, and within two hours she was rescued while being taken away in an auto-rickshaw, police said. The accused had allegedly kidnapped her with an intent to sexually assault her, police added.

44.title: Harassed by rivals, Thane cable operator jumps before train, dies
44.article_body: A 45-year-old cable operator from Thane's Dombivli, Pralhad Narayan Patil, killed himself by jumping in front of a train on Saturday over alleged harassment from his rivals. The police have booked 15 people for abetment. "All the 15 accused had also started a cable operating business in Sandap village and they allegedly harassed Patil," said a police official.

45.title: Police release photos of suspects who opened fire in Begusarai, announce ₹50,000 bounty
45.article_body: Police have released photos of bike-borne assailants who opened fire on random people at multiple locations in Bihar's Begusarai. Police have also announced a bounty of ₹50,000 on the accused. At least one person was killed and nine others were injured in the firing. "Some have been released from the hospital," Begusarai SP Yogendra Kumar said.

46.title: India confirms disengagement with Chinese troops at Hot Springs in Ladakh
46.article_body: Minister of External Affairs S Jaishankar on Wednesday confirmed that Indian and Chinese troops have completed the disengagement process at Patrolling Point-15 in the Gogra-Hot Springs area in eastern Ladakh. The minister said, "I would recognise that we had disengagement at PP-15...the disengagement, as I understand, is completed, and that is one problem less on the border."

47.title: Royal guard collapses while protecting the Queen's coffin
47.article_body: A Royal guard fainted and fell off the podium where he was protecting the Queen's coffin. The live stream was cut out for several minutes as police rushed to the guard's aid. Commenting on the video showing the guard collapsing, a social media user wrote, "It's such a massive responsibility. I hope he's fine."

48.title: I believe this Indian team can bring home the T20 WC trophy: Gavaskar
48.article_body: Amid debate over India's 15-member squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup in Australia, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said he believes that the Rohit Sharma-led side can bring home the trophy. "Once the team is selected, then it's our India team and we all have to back it," he added. The Super 12 stage will begin on October 22.

49.title: MCI, PSG, Madrid register wins in Champions League; Chelsea held to 1-1 draw
49.article_body: Norwegian striker Erling Haaland provided the late winner against his former club Borussia Dortmund as Manchester City won 2-1 in their group stage game on Wednesday night. PSG and Real Madrid also registered wins in their respective games against Maccabi Haifa and Leipzig. Chelsea, however, were held to a 1-1 draw at home against Salzburg.

50.title: PVR investors to offload 7.7% stake via block deal today: Report
50.article_body: PVR's investors will reportedly offload a 7.7% stake in the company via a block deal on Thursday. Multiples PE, Grey Birch, Plenty PE and Berry Invt are among the investors selling stake and the offer price for the block deal may range from ₹1,852-₹1,929 apiece. PVR will also offer up to 4% stake via block deals, a report said.

51.title: No plans to set up unit in Punjab: BMW denies CM Bhagwant Mann's claim
51.article_body: In a statement, German luxury car manufacturer BMW said it has "no plans" to set up a manufacturing unit in Punjab. This comes a day after the Punjab government said the company had agreed to set up its plant after CM Bhagwant Mann showcased the state's "exemplary work" to promote industry, following which BMW decided to install a unit there.

52.title: Woman killed grandmother to rob her to repay loans: Pune Police
52.article_body: After a 70-year-old woman was found dead in Pune's Warje, police arrested her 24-year-old granddaughter on charges of killing her. The woman killed her grandmother to rob her of cash and valuables to repay the loans that she had taken from online credit platforms, police said. Police had found a razor blade next to the body of the deceased.

53.title: Mumbai man loses lakhs in extortion after woman undresses on video call
53.article_body: A 75-year-old Mumbai man was blackmailed into giving ₹2.21 lakh to frauds posing as an IPS officer and a journalist. According to police, he received a video call in which he saw a woman undressing. She asked him to strip as well after which he disconnected the call. He then received calls threatening him of uploading the video online.

54.title: Only 2 hour-long classes in Northeast Delhi govt schools: PIL in HC
54.article_body: A Public Interest Litigation (PIL) moved in Delhi High Court has claimed that some of the Delhi government-run schools in the Northeast district are conducting only two hours of classes. These school hours are in violation of provisions of the Right to Education Act, 2009, the PIL stated. Nearly one lakh students are getting affected, the PIL added.

55.title: If Mamata wants to open fire on protestors, she'll have to leave CM chair: Suvendu
55.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari said if West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee wants to "open fire on protestors", she'll have to leave the CM chair. His statement came while reacting to the violence that ensued in BJP's 'Nabanna Cholo' rally on Tuesday. Adhikari said that the party's 'Nabanna Cholo' became a mass movement against corruption and dynastic politics in West Bengal.

56.title: TSRTC starts 4 new buses from Dilsukhnagar to Kokapet in Hyderabad
56.article_body: The Telangana State Road Transport Corporation (TSRTC) has started four new bus services from Dilsukhnagar to Kokapet in Hyderabad. "Residents of Kokapet, Gandipet, Narsingi and surrounding areas can avail these services, and reach their destinations easily," TSRTC said. The first bus is scheduled to start from Dilsukhnagar at 6 am and the last bus service is at 8:42 pm.

57.title: Parts of Bengaluru to face scheduled power cuts today
57.article_body: The Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) has proposed some scheduled power shutdowns in parts of the city today to carry out maintenance and repair works. Power supply will be hit in the affected areas between 10 am and 4 pm. The areas that will be affected today include Kengeri, Davangere, Madhugiri, Chitradurga, etc.

58.title: Owner of US-based firm donates entire company worth $3 billion to fight climate crisis
58.article_body: The billionaire owner of a US-based sportswear brand is giving away ownership of the brand that started some 50 years ago to a trust that will use its profit to fight the climate crisis. The company, Patagonia, is reportedly worth about $3 billion. "We'll use the wealth Patagonia creates to protect the source of all wealth," said owner Yvon Chouinard.

59.title: Not the first time: Student as SPPU faces 12-hour power cut
59.article_body: The Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) witnessed a power cut for about 12 hours, starting from late Tuesday night to Wednesday afternoon. SPPU Registrar Prafulla Pawar attributed it to the heavy rain. "This is not the first time the issue with the power supply has cropped up…It has become more common in the past few months," said a student.

60.title: We chose Gujarat for semiconductor facility based on independent advice: Vedanta
60.article_body: Commenting on Vedanta-Foxconn's decision to set up a semiconductor facility in Gujarat instead of Maharashtra, Vedanta Resources Ltd Chairman Anil Agarwal said, "Maharashtra made effort to outbid other states...we chose Gujarat based on independent advice." He added, "We decided on Gujarat earlier...they met our expectations." The company is committed to investing in Maharashtra, Agarwal stated.

61.title: 14-yr-old boy found dead at Mumbai shelter home, case registered
61.article_body: Police have registered a case of abetment to suicide after a 14-year-old boy ended his life at a shelter home in Mumbai. According to police, the boy took the step on Monday after he was allegedly scolded by the class monitor. The incident came to light when another inmate went to use the bathroom, where the deceased was found hanging.

62.title: Swaminarayan temple in Canada vandalised with anti-India graffiti, India issues statement
62.article_body: The BAPS Swaminarayan temple in Toronto, Canada was vandalised with anti-India graffiti. The High Commission of India in Ottawa strongly condemned the incident on Thursday. In a statement issued on Twitter, the High Commission said, "Have requested Canadian authorities to investigate the incident and take prompt action on perpetrators."

63.title: Car crashes into Ukraine President Zelenskyy's car
63.article_body: A car crashed into Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's car in Kyiv, according to a statement from the President's press secretary. "The President was examined by a doctor, no serious injuries were found," the statement said. Medics accompanying Zelenskyy gave emergency aid to the car's driver and transferred him to an ambulance, it added.

64.title: Former ICC elite umpire Asad Rauf passes away aged 66 in Lahore
64.article_body: Former ICC elite umpire Asad Rauf passed away aged 66 in Pakistan's Lahore on Wednesday. As per reports, Rauf died after suffering a heart attack while he was going home from his shop. Rauf had quit umpiring in 2013. He stood as an umpire in 178 international matches and was third umpire in 64 international matches.

65.title: Elon Musk's Starlink arrives in Antarctica, now on all 7 continents
65.article_body: Elon Musk-led SpaceX's Starlink satellite internet service arrived in Antarctica, the National Science Foundation announced on Twitter. It stated Starlink is testing polar service with a newly deployed user terminal at McMurdo Station. "Starlink is now on all seven continents! In such a remote location like Antarctica, this capability is enabled by Starlink's space laser network," SpaceX tweeted.

66.title: ED seizes 91.5 kg of gold, 340 kg of silver worth ₹47 cr from Mumbai firm
66.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has seized 91.5 kg of gold and 340 kg of silver, collectively worth ₹47.76 crore, as part of a money laundering probe linked to an alleged bank loan fraud case. The premises of Raksha Bullion and Classic Marbles were raided in connection with the case against a company called Parekh Aluminex Ltd., the agency said.

67.title: 6 local trains plying in Mumbai between 1:00-5:00 am on Sept 16 cancelled
67.article_body: A power and traffic block will lead to cancellation of six local trains on the Western Railway between 1:10 am and 5:10 am on September 16. Rail traffic will be blocked on all lines at Lower Parel due to ongoing work at the Delisle Road Overbridge. The work will also cause six local trains to remain partially cancelled.

68.title: Ghaziabad man receives death threat via WhatsApp call, case filed
68.article_body: Ghaziabad Police has registered a case on a complaint filed by a man over allegedly receiving death threats via a WhatsApp call. The cyber cell is verifying the number from which the WhatsApp call was made, said Muniraj G, Senior SP, Ghaziabad. The investigation will reveal if the call came from the US or any other foreign country, he added.

69.title: Lalu Prasad Yadav visits RJD office in Patna after several years
69.article_body: Lalu Prasad Yadav, the founding president of Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD), visited the party office in Bihar's Patna on Wednesday after a gap of several years due to imprisonment and ill health. "Our national president finalised the programme for [RJD's] national executive...in Delhi next month," senior leaders said after his visit. Notably, Lalu is awaiting a kidney transplant in Singapore.

70.title: India makes its own decisions: US on military drills in Russia
70.article_body: The US has rejected questions on India’s participation in a military exercise hosted by Russia, saying New Delhi makes its own decisions. Pentagon Spokesman Brig Gen Patrick Ryder said the US will continue to work with India. India was among a host of nations to participate in Vostok 2022 exercise, which was held across Russia earlier this month.

71.title: It is policy to provide maintenance: US on jet sustenance programme for Pak
71.article_body: The US has defended approving a $450 million F-16 fighter jet fleet sustenance programme to the Pakistani Air Force, saying it is policy to provide "lifecycle maintenance and sustainment packages for US-origin platforms". US Spokesperson Ned Price said Pakistan is an important counterterrorism partner. The sustenance programme is the US' first major security assistance to Pakistan in four years.

72.title: Partha Chatterjee's bail plea rejected in SSC scam case
72.article_body: A special court in Kolkata on Wednesday rejected the bail plea of former West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee and sent him to judicial remand till September 28 in the School Service Commission (SSC) recruitment scam case. Notably, Chatterjee broke down during the hearing while pleading for bail. Meanwhile, the court also extended the judicial remand of Chatterjee's aide Arpita Mukherjee.

73.title: 3rd suspect arrested in Argentine VP's attempted assassination
73.article_body: A third suspect has been arrested in the attempted assassination of Argentine Vice President Cristina Fernández. While Agustina Díaz was detained earlier this week, two others Fernando Sabag Montiel and his girlfriend Brenda Uliarte were arrested shortly after the incident. On September 1, Montiel had pointed a handgun at the vice-president but the gun did not go off.

74.title: How many deaths will it take?: Pope on Russia-Ukraine war
74.article_body: Pope Francis on Wednesday asked "how many deaths will it take" for peace to triumph, as the Russia-Ukraine war nears seven months since its beginning. The Pope was speaking to the Russian Orthodox hierarchy in Kazakhstan when he made the comments, though he did not mention Russia or Ukraine. He said religious leaders must promote peace.

75.title: PM Modi to discuss cooperation under UN with Russian Prez: Kremlin
75.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will discuss bilateral cooperation with Russian President Vladimir Putin during the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) summit in Uzbekistan on September 15 and 16. The two leaders will discuss cooperation within the G20 and the United Nations frameworks, the Kremlin said. Modi is also expected to meet Chinese President Xi Jinping during the summit.

76.title: Vinesh creates history, becomes 1st Indian woman wrestler to win 2 World C'ships medals
76.article_body: Wrestler Vinesh Phogat on Wednesday created history by becoming the first-ever Indian woman wrestler to win at least two medals in World Championships. The 28-year-old defeated Sweden's Jonna Malmgren 8-0 to bag bronze in the 53-kg category at the 2022 World Wrestling Championships in Belgrade. She had bagged her first World Championships medal, a bronze, in 2019.

77.title: Social bonds stretched to polarise voters: Sonia Gandhi
77.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi has alleged constitutional values are under assault in the country with social bonds being deliberately stretched to polarise voters. In an op-ed article in the Hindustan Times, Gandhi wrote power was concentrated over the last eight years in the hands of few politicians. She further said independent authorities were now reduced to "tools of the executive".

78.title: China's Xi meets Kazakh leader on 1st foreign trip since pandemic
78.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping visited Kazakhstan on Wednesday which is his first foreign tour since the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic. Xi met Kazakhstan President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev and the two leaders discussed the energy markets and the global economic situation, according to a statement. Xi's visit to Kazakhstan comes ahead of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in Uzbekistan.

79.title: William and Harry walk side by side behind Queen Elizabeth's coffin, pic goes viral
79.article_body: Prince William and Prince Harry walked side by side behind their grandmother Queen Elizabeth II's coffin on Wednesday. The brothers were taking part in a procession from Buckingham Palace to Westminster Hall, where the queen's body will lie in state for four days until her funeral. Their father King Charles was in front of them.

80.title: Unarmed policeman attacked with iron rods: TMC's Abhishek on Nabanna march
80.article_body: TMC General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee on Wednesday criticised BJP after a video showing assault on policeman during the party's 'Nabanna Cholo' march went viral on social media. "An unarmed police officer was attacked with iron rods and sticks, police van was set ablaze," Banerjee said. "Police could've fired bullets instead of using teargas...but they chose to show restraint," he added.

81.title: NCC cadet punches bus conductor after row over ticket in MP: Report
81.article_body: An NCC cadet reportedly punched the conductor of a state-run BCLL bus in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal on Tuesday. The incident reportedly took place after the conductor asked the cadet to buy a ticket. A CCTV footage showed the man, who was dressed in a uniform, repeatedly attacking the conductor before getting off the bus.

82.title: Australia's Mitchell Starc, Mitchell Marsh & Marcus Stoinis ruled out of India T20I tour
82.article_body: Australia's Mitchell Starc, Mitchell Marsh and Marcus Stoinis have been ruled out of the upcoming T20I series against India. Starc (knee), Marsh (ankle) and Stoinis (side) have low-level injuries, Cricket Australia said. They have been replaced by Nathan Ellis, Daniel Sams and Sean Abbott. The three-match tour starts in Mohali on September 20.

83.title: Who are the highest-ranked Indian cricketers in the latest rankings?
83.article_body: As per the latest men's cricket rankings, Rishabh Pant is the highest-ranked Indian Test batter, while Ravichandran Ashwin and Ravindra Jadeja are top-ranked Indian bowler and Indian all-rounder, respectively. In ODIs, Virat Kohli is the top-ranked Indian batter, while Suryakumar Yadav is the top-ranked Indian batter in T20Is. Hardik Pandya is the top-ranked Indian all-rounder in ODIs and T20Is.

84.title: Jacqueline grilled for 8 hours in money laundering case, given a list of 100 questions
84.article_body: The Economic Offences Wing of Delhi Police handed over a list of 100 questions to Jacqueline Fernandez in the alleged ₹200 crore scam in the Sukesh Chandrasekhar case. She was under investigation since 11:30 am on Wednesday, which took place for over eight hours. The questions mostly pertained to her relationship with Sukesh and the gifts she received from him.

85.title: Which WI players from last year's T20 WC squad don't feature in T20 WC 2022 squad?
85.article_body: West Indies today announced their squad for the T20 World Cup 2022. As many as 10 players, who were in West Indies' squad for T20 World Cup 2021, don't feature in this year's squad. They are Kieron Pollard, Dwayne Bravo, Andre Fletcher, Ravi Rampaul, Lendl Simmons, Hayden Walsh, Roston Chase, Chris Gayle, Andre Russell and Oshane Thomas.

86.title: Patna ADM removed after video showed him thrashing job aspirant
86.article_body: Patna Additional District Magistrate (Law and Order) KK Singh, who allegedly beat up a teaching job aspirant during a protest last month, was removed from the post on Wednesday. He has been transferred to the General Administration Department in Bihar. A video went viral showing him beating up the teaching job aspirant who was holding the national flag.

87.title: India no.1 in sending students to US colleges & universities: US Embassy India
87.article_body: "India is the number one country for sending students to US colleges and universities," Minister Counsellor for Consular Affairs US Embassy in New Delhi Don Heflin said. "We issued 82,000 student visas this summer...a record for us," he said. According to Open Doors report, there were 1,67,582 students from India in the 2020-2021 academic year in the US.

88.title: Trucking marketplace Raaho looking to raise $20 mn: CEO
88.article_body: Intercity trucking marketplace Raaho is looking to raise $20 million in the next one year to expand its operations in India, Co-founder and Chief Executive Officer Mohammed Imthiaz said. Raaho enables tracking freight in real-time through its technology and Imthiaz added that they are looking to become the largest digital freight marketplace. Raaho raised $1.65 million in 2021.

89.title: Govt to soon invite bids for privatisation of IDBI Bank: DIPAM Secy
89.article_body: Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey on Wednesday said the department would soon invite preliminary bids from investors for the privatisation of IDBI Bank. "It's...first of its kind transaction where through a bidding route we'll be privatising...bank," he said. The government presently holds 45.48% stake in the bank and LIC owns a 49.24% stake.

90.title: Punjab Police files FIR after AAP alleges BJP offering ₹25 cr to MLAs to switch sides
90.article_body: Punjab Police on Wednesday filed a case after AAP alleged that BJP was trying to topple the state government by attempting to poach its MLAs. Punjab Finance Minister Harpal Singh Cheema alleged that BJP has contacted some 7 to 10 of its MLAs in the past week. He added BJP offered them up to ₹25 crore each to switch sides.

91.title: Ukraine claims to discover 'torture chamber' used by Russian troops
91.article_body: Ukraine has claimed to discover a 'torture chamber' used by Russian troops to hold Ukrainian prisoners. The torture chamber was found in the basement of a police station in Balakliya, the Ukrainian city that was recently liberated after being occupied by Russia for more than six months. "The Lord's Prayer was carved on the wall by Ukrainian prisoners," said Ukraine.

92.title: EV startups will disrupt India's automotive market: Amitabh Kant
92.article_body: Former CEO of Niti Aayog Amitabh Kant said that electric vehicle (EV) startups will disrupt India's automotive market, adding that the auto industry needs to reinvent itself as the country transits towards e-mobility. "The market for electrics is going to explode in the days to come," Kant said. He added that Indian startups can shake up the automobile traditional market.

93.title: Will ask other states too: NCPCR on illegal madrassas' survey in UP, Assam
93.article_body: National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) chief Priyank Kanoongo said the statutory body will remind other states to carry out surveys of illegal madrassas, as is being done in UP, Assam and Uttarakhand. "There are no fundamental formal studies that are being imparted. The children were misbehaved with in madrassas, which is also against the Constitution," Kanoongo added.

94.title: Punjab Police ASI arrested for taking ₹2,000 bribe
94.article_body: Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) Lakhwinder Singh of Punjab Police was arrested on Wednesday for allegedly taking a bribe of ₹2,000. A resident of Kapurthala had approached Punjab Vigilance Bureau alleging that he had a dispute with his partner at a shop and Singh demanded bribe to help him in the matter. Following the complaint, officials arrested Singh red-handed, a spokesperson said.

95.title: VHP activists make men hold ears & apologise over roadside namaz in UP, video surfaces
95.article_body: Vishva Hindu Parishad activists confronted a group of men who were on their way to Ajmer, making them apologise for offering namaz by the roadside in UP's Shahjahanpur and sending them to the local police station. A video showed some men holding their ears. "They were released after receiving...apology in writing and issuing a challan," a police official said.

96.title: Ready to assist probe: Partha breaks down during hearing in SSC scam case
96.article_body: Ex-West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee broke down during his virtual court hearing on Wednesday in the School Service Commission (SSC) recruitment scam case and stated that he's a "victim of political conspiracy". "I'm ready to offer all assistance to the [probe]...Considering my mental...state, please consider my bail," he said. Chatterjee and his aide Arpita Mukherjee were arrested in July.

97.title: Singer Jesse Powell passes away aged 51
97.article_body: Jesse Powell, the singer-songwriter best known for his '90s hit 'You', has died aged 51, his family said in a statement. The Grammy-nominated R&B artist "passed away peacefully" at his home in Los Angeles, according to the statement. Powell's family has not provided details about the circumstances surrounding his death.

98.title: 400-year-old Nayak-era stone inscription found at Tamil Nadu temple
98.article_body: Students and professors of Mannar Thirumalai Naicker College have found a 400-year-old Nayak-era stone inscription at a Vinayagar temple in Theni, Tamil Nadu. The stone has symbols of the Sun, the Moon and a lotus with blurred letters. Retired archaeologist Dr Santhalingam said that the inscriptions talk about a donation by Muthu Veerappa Nayak, a ruler of Madurai Nayak Kingdom.

99.title: Ravindra Jadeja shares pic of him walking on crutches
99.article_body: Cricketer Ravindra Jadeja, who recently underwent knee surgery, took to social media to share a picture of him walking on crutches. He wrote, "One step at a time." Commenting on his post on Instagram, former India batter Suresh Raina wrote, "@ravindra.jadeja get well soon brother! See you soon." Jadeja underwent surgery after being ruled out of Asia Cup 2022 midway.

100.title: West Indies announce their squad for T20 World Cup 2022
100.article_body: West Indies on Wednesday announced their squad for T20 World Cup 2022. The team will be led by Nicholas Pooran, while Rovman Powell has been named vice-captain. Opener Evin Lewis has been recalled for the first time since T20 World Cup 2021. The squad also includes two uncapped players: right-arm leg-spinner allrounder Yannic Cariah and left-arm batting allrounder Raymon Reifer.

101.title: Article 370 was not an obstacle in J&K's development: Azad
101.article_body: Former Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad said Article 370 was not an obstacle in the development of Jammu and Kashmir. "I've countered the PM and the Home Minister in Parliament on this issue," Azad said. "I've highlighted 30 indices where Jammu and Kashmir under Article 370 outperformed...national average and 40 indices where it fared better than Gujarat," Azad added.

102.title: 'Moonlighting' not ethically right for full-time employees: IBM's India MD
102.article_body: Sandip Patel, the MD for IBM India/South Asia region, said, "All of our workers when they are employed, they sign an agreement which says that they're going to be working full-time for IBM." He added, "So moonlighting is not ethically right for them to get into." 'Moonlighting' refers to the practice of taking up secondary jobs after regular work hours.

103.title: Audiences have right to reject bad content: Simbu on boycott trend
103.article_body: Actor Simbu, speaking about the ongoing boycott trend against Bollywood films, has said that content decides the "fate" of movies. "I don't think audiences should be blamed because they won't boycott a good film...At the same time, audiences have all the right to reject bad content and we have no say in it," he further stated.

104.title: Govt exercised restraint against violent BJP protestors: Mamata
104.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said that the administration exercised "maximum restraint" against the BJP protestors who were violent in their march to the state secretariat. Alleging that the rally participants brutally attacked police personnel, she said, "Police could have opened fire." She also said that the administration has nothing against democratic and peaceful protests.

105.title: PM Narendra Modi will become PM again in 2024: Goa CM Pramod Sawant
105.article_body:
After eight Congress MLAs joined the BJP in Goa, CM Pramod Sawant said, in 2024 under the leadership of PM Narendra Modi, the party will have over 400 MPs from Kanniyakumari to Kashmir.
"PM Narendra Modi will become PM again," Pramod Sawant said. "We are moving forward to make India a world leader," Sawant added.

106.title: Every effort will be made for Agnipath recruitment rallies: Mann
106.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Wednesday extended total support to the Army's Agnipath recruitment rallies, saying "every effort will be made" for the drives. Mann's comments came after an Army zonal officer said there was "lack of support" from local authorities in Punjab. Aam Aadmi Party national convener Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday said the party will "fully support" the scheme.

107.title: SoftBank considers launching a third Vision Fund: Report
107.article_body: Japan's SoftBank Group is considering launching a third Vision Fund to invest in startups, according to a report. The size of the fund isn't finalised and is likely to see the infusion of its own capital. Last month, SoftBank CEO Masayoshi Son said that the Vision Fund investment arm would be restructured after it reported a $50 billion loss.

108.title: All paramedical institutes in UP to be geo-tagged to curb fraud: Report
108.article_body: UP's State Medical Faculty has reportedly decided that all healthcare facilities attached to para-medical institutes will be geo-tagged. "[During inspection], there are chances that...inspectors...are shown...other well-equipped hospitals to get a better scorecard. [This will be curbed] through geo-tagging," an official said. Nearly 1,200 institutes reportedly offer paramedical courses in UP.

109.title: 2 held as 8 killed in fire at e-bike showroom in Secunderabad
109.article_body: The police have arrested the owners of the Ruby Pride hotel and Gemopai e-bikes showroom after a fire in a building, in Secunderabad, housing the two killed eight people and injured 10 others. CM K Chandrashekar Rao announced ex-gratia of ₹3 lakh. PM Narendra Modi said that ₹2 lakh will be paid to the families of those who died.

110.title: Northeast Frontier Railway turns old train coaches to restaurants
110.article_body: The Northeast Frontier Railway (NFR) has converted old train coaches into restaurants to increase revenue and create jobs. A statement said that NFR has opened two coach restaurants, one at Katihar in Bihar and the other at New Jalpaiguri station in Bengal. With the proliferation of the new LHB coaches, old coaches of the Indian Railways are being phased out.

111.title: 35,000 buses in Karnataka to go electric by 2030: Minister
111.article_body: Karnataka Transport Minister B Sriramulu said the state government is planning to convert 35,000 buses to electric by 2030 keeping in mind environment and pollution related concerns. He added that with the rising costs of diesel, they were incurring losses. The Minister also said that the Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) is operating electric buses on a contractual basis.

112.title: Eating non-veg food no taboo, can't be banned but avoid beef: RSS leader
112.article_body: RSS leader J Nandakumar said on Wednesday that consumption of non-vegetarian food isn't a taboo and cannot be banned in India. "As per the climate conditions and geographic locations, people do eat such food," Nandakumar said, adding that it's the "staple diet" for a section of the population. Nandakumar, however, added that consumption of beef should be avoided.

113.title: Hindi acts as bridge between different states: Rajasthan CM Gehlot
113.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Wednesday said that Hindi language acts as a bridge between different states of the country. He added that it is an effective medium for the expression of thoughts. Addressing a state-level Hindi Diwas function in Jaipur, Gehlot said that the language has played an important role in increasing the spirit of brotherhood among the countrymen.

114.title: Goldman downgrades Infosys & TCS stocks to 'sell', upgrades Wipro's: Report
114.article_body: Goldman Sachs has reportedly downgraded Indian IT service providers Tata Consultancy Services and Infosys' stock to "sell" from "buy". It cited a potential slowdown in dollar revenue growth in the face of impending macroeconomic stress for downgrading the stock. Meanwhile, it has upgraded Wipro's stock to "buy" from "sell," citing attractive valuations and a recent pickup in Wipro's order book.

115.title: Imran Khan had agreed to play Pak PM in 1997 film: Mukul Anand's brother
115.article_body: Late director Mukul Anand's brother Rahul S Anand has revealed that former Pakistan PM Imran Khan had agreed to play the Prime Minister of Pakistan in the 1997 film 'Dus'. However, the Salman Khan-starrer film did not release as filmmaker Mukul had passed away. Rahul stated, "It's a big coincidence...Imran did become the Prime Minister of Pakistan!"

116.title: Cabinet approves plan to add Himachal's Hatti community to ST list
116.article_body: The Union Cabinet on Wednesday approved an amendment bill which gives tribal status to Himachal Pradesh's Hatti community. PM Narendra Modi chaired the Cabinet meeting. Union Minister of Tribal Affairs Arjun Munda said the Cabinet further approved proposals to give Scheduled Tribes (ST) status to the Narikoravan and Kurivikkaran communities in Tamil Nadu and the Binjhia community in Chhattisgarh.

117.title: Sikkim govt hikes minimum wages across all categories
117.article_body: The Sikkim government raised the minimum wages across all categories on Wednesday. Now unskilled workers will get ₹500 daily, instead of ₹300. The daily wage for semi-skilled workers was increased from ₹320 to ₹520 and skilled workers will earn ₹535 instead of ₹335. Labour Minister Lok Nath Sharma said the wage hike will be implemented retrospectively from July 11, 2022.

118.title: US mortgage interest rates rise above 6% for first time since 2008
118.article_body: US mortgage interest rates increased above 6% for the first time since 2008, Mortgage Bankers Association (MBA) data showed on Wednesday. The average contract rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage increased by seven basis points to 6.01% for the week ending September 9. MBA added its Market Composite Index (MCI) declined 1.2% from a week earlier.

119.title: COVID-19's end is in sight: WHO Chief
119.article_body: The World Health Organization's (WHO) Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus on Wednesday said that the world has never been in a better position to end the COVID-19 pandemic. "We are not there yet. But the end is in sight," he added. He, however, urged the nations to keep up their efforts against the virus that has killed over six million people.

120.title: Punjab AAP files complaint against BJP for 'attempting' to poach its MLAs
120.article_body: Punjab Finance Minister Harpal Singh Cheema and 11 AAP MLAs on Wednesday filed a police complaint against BJP for allegedly trying to poach its MLAs by offering them up to ₹25 crore each. Cheema earlier alleged that BJP has contacted some seven to 10 of its MLAs in the past week. He added that AAP MLAs were also being threatened.

121.title: Twilio to cut staff by 11% to reduce costs, improve margins
121.article_body: Cloud communications platform Twilio on Wednesday said it plans to cut its staff by nearly 11% to reduce its costs, improve operating margins and create a better selling capacity. The firm's restructuring will be completed by the end of Q4 2022, Twilio added. Twilio estimates it'll incur between $70-$90 million in charges over restructuring plans.

122.title: SRK to shoot action sequence with 200 women for 'Jawan': Report
122.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan will reportedly shoot an action sequence with 200 women in Chennai for his upcoming film 'Jawan'. As per reports, the sequence will be shot in seven days. The film is directed by Atlee and will also feature actress Nayanthara and actor Vijay Sethupathi. The film will release on June 2, 2023.

123.title: What if Bengal followed UP's bulldozer model: Mahua on BJP rally violence
123.article_body: Reacting to the violence that ensued in BJP's 'Nabanna Cholo' rally on Tuesday, TMC MP Mahua Moitra asked if Bengal should also follow UP's 'bulldozer model'. "What if Bengal used [UP's bulldozer] model and...[razed] homes of BJP workers who destroyed public property yesterday? Will BJP stand by [its]...policy?" she tweeted. BJP claimed that 1,235 workers of their party were arrested.

124.title: Drunk MP students snatch policeman's phone, beat up driver after argument
124.article_body: Some drunk students of a medical college in MP snatched a policeman's phone and beat up the driver of a police vehicle following an argument with a patrolling team on Wednesday, police said. The incident took place after City Superintendent of Police Rishikesh Meena spotted the youths in an inebriated condition around 2 am, said ASP Mrigakhi Deka.

125.title: Better to be agent of PM Modi, Amit Shah than Yakub Memon: Maha CM
125.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde said it is better to be agents of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah than being an agent of 1993 Mumbai blasts convict Yakub Memon. "[Memon's] grave was glorified. It happened under whose regime?...[Modi and Shah] took ideology of Balasaheb Thackeray ahead and also scrapped Article 370," Shinde added.

126.title: AP Dhillon throws official ceremonial first pitch for Canadian baseball team, pics surface
126.article_body: Punjab-born Canadian singer AP Dhillon on Tuesday night threw the official ceremonial first pitch for Canadian baseball team Toronto Blue Jays in their MLB match against the Tampa Bay Rays. Sharing pictures on Twitter, Toronto Blue Jays wrote, "‼️Brown Munde‼️ Big thanks to the legend - AP Dhillon - for throwing tonight’s first pitch!"

127.title: 13-yr-old Atherton creates history, becomes youngest ever senior footballer in UK
127.article_body: Northern Irish football club Glenavon's Christopher Atherton has created history by becoming the youngest ever senior footballer in the UK. He achieved the feat by debuting for the club's senior team aged 13 years and 329 days against Dollingstown in Northern Ireland Football League Cup. The previous record was held by Eamonn Collins (14 years and 323 days).

128.title: Movie mafia decide which film is hit or flop: Kangana on Brahmastra
128.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut took to Instagram Stories and shared a tweet of a box office website that termed 'Brahmastra' a "big failure" over its collection. Reacting to the tweet, she wrote, "This is only to put in perspective how the movie mafia works...they...decide which film will be declared a hit...which will be called a flop regardless of its collections."

129.title: SBI authorised to promote Rupee trade with Russia: Export industry body Prez
129.article_body: India has decided to authorise State Bank of India (SBI) to promote Rupee trade with Russia and soon, Russia will name its bank to operationalise the mechanism, said Federation of Indian Export Organisation President A Sakthivel. "[Commerce Secretary BVR Subrahmanyam] said very soon Russian government is going to identify a bank...Rupee trade with Russia will happen," Sakthivel said.

130.title: PM Modi is quicker than cheetah when evading serious issues: Owaisi
130.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday said that PM Narendra Modi is quicker than a cheetah when it comes to evading serious issues. "I am saying all this in a lighter vein so that the UAPA is not invoked against me," he said, adding that he was unhappy with the UP government's decision to conduct surveys of privately-run madrassas.

131.title: 3 Muslim clerics booked for raping woman in UP's Mathura
131.article_body: Three Muslim clerics have been booked for raping a woman in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura. One of the accused, Rashid, who first raped the woman, had reportedly promised to marry her but declined later. After this, two other clerics also allegedly raped her. Moreover, when the woman's family approached the secretary of the mosque, he helped the accused escape, police said.

132.title: Kolkata Mayor visits BJP councillor injured during 'Nabanna Cholo' march
132.article_body: Kolkata Mayor Firhad Hakim on Wednesday visited BJP councillor Meena Devi Purohit at a hospital where she was admitted after suffering injuries during BJP's 'Nabanna Cholo' march. "She has suffered an injury on her head and I wished her speedy recovery," Hakim said. Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has enquired about the BJP councillor's health, Hakim added.

133.title: India's trade deficit widens to $27.98 billion in August: Govt
133.article_body: India's merchandise trade deficit widened to $27.98 billion in August 2022 from $11.71 billion a year earlier, revised data released by the government showed on Wednesday. The country's merchandise exports rose to $33.92 billion in August from $33.38 billion in the same period last year. Meanwhile, India's imports rose to $61.90 billion in August from $45.09 billion last year.

134.title: Leonardo DiCaprio, Gigi Hadid spark dating rumours after his breakup with Camila Morrone
134.article_body: Actor Leonardo DiCaprio, 47, who recently broke up with Camila Morrone, has sparked dating rumours with 27-year-old model Gigi Hadid. They were spotted at a New York Fashion Week after-party in the city and seemed to be secluded from the rest of the party, said Daily Mail. A report said while they are dating, they are "taking it slow".

135.title: 6 trekkers discover a lake in Uttarakhand after first spotting it on Google Earth
135.article_body: Six trekkers in their 20s have discovered a crystal clear lake at an altitude of around 16,000 feet in Uttarakhand's Rudraprayag district after one of them first spotted it on Google Earth. "We did some research and decided to explore the lake," said Abhisekh Panwar, one of the trekkers. Beating inhospitable climate conditions, they discovered the lake on September 1.

136.title: Went to temple & asked God before joining BJP: Ex-Goa CM on leaving Cong
136.article_body: Former Goa CM Digambar Kamat on Wednesday said that he went to a temple and asked God what to do before he joined BJP. "God told me do whatever is best for you," he said. Eight Congress MLAs joined BJP, with the Opposition dubbing the move as the "height of betrayal and shamelessness" on part of the MLAs.

137.title: Who cares about $300 million? I can raise $300 million in a week: Byju's CEO
137.article_body: Byju's CEO Byju Raveendran spoke to Moneycontrol about the delay in investments committed by Sumeru Ventures and Oxshott Capital Partners. "The $300 million from Sumeru and Oxshott is not coming, but that's not our mistake," he said. "But who cares about $300 million? I can raise $300 million in a week," he added.

138.title: K'taka school principal, staffer arrested for sexually harassing girls
138.article_body: The principal and a computer operator of a government residential school in Karnataka's Kalaburagi district have been arrested for allegedly sexually harassing girl students. A total of 10 girls said they had faced sexual harassment, police said, adding that one of the girls also attempted suicide. The arrests were made after a video showed some girls complaining about them.

139.title: Will use abusive language in films & shows only if important: Pankaj Tripathi
139.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi said he has decided not to use abusive language in his films and shows. "Ji meine taye kar liya hai ki mere jo bhi kirdaar honge ati aavashyak hua toh mein use creative tarah se dikhaunga (Yes, I've decided if my character demands it, then I'll choose to portray it in a creative way)," he said.

140.title: BJP brought goons with bombs from outside WB for 'Nabanna Cholo' march: CM
140.article_body: After BJP's 'Nabanna Cholo' march turned violent in Kolkata on Tuesday, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee criticised the BJP and said the party brought goons armed with bombs from outside the state for the march. "We have nothing against democratic and peaceful protests," Banerjee said. "But, the BJP and its supporters resorted to violence, vandalism and arson," she added.

141.title: Google cancels plans to release Pixelbook in 2023: Report
141.article_body: Google has cancelled plans to launch the next version of the Pixelbook laptop, according to a report. Pixelbook was expected to release next year, however, the plan has now allegedly been cancelled as part of recent cost-cutting measures inside Google. The company has reportedly dissolved the team as well and transferred them elsewhere inside the company.

142.title: 8-yr-old boy dies, 3 injured as school toilet's ceiling collapses in U'khand
142.article_body: The ceiling of a toilet at a primary school collapsed in Uttarakhand's Champawat district on Wednesday, killing an eight-year-old male student and injuring three others. The students who received injuries are also aged eight. Locals said they had complained to the school administration regarding the dilapidated condition of its building, but no action was taken.

143.title: I'm learning from everything: Ayan on criticism of Brahmastra dialogues
143.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji has reacted to the criticism of dialogues in his film 'Brahmastra'. "I am observing. The feedback from the audience [and] critics is very important to shape what we do in the future. I am learning from everything," he stated. Ayan added that he wanted to create an "idealistic love story in the fantasy world".

144.title: Attempted JEE Main for practice: NEET topper who scored 99+ percentile in JEE Main
144.article_body: Seventeen-year-old Tanishka, who topped NEET UG 2022, also scored 99+ percentile in JEE Main. She claimed that she has always wanted to become a doctor and took the engineering entrance exam only for practice. "I did not have any focused preparation for JEE Main...I took the JEE Main to understand my level of preparedness," she stated.

145.title: People have written nasty things about me in reviews: Dulquer Salmaan
145.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan has said that people have written "nasty" things about him in their reviews. "People have even written that I should quit movies and I am not made for it...It's really harsh," he added. Dulquer will next feature in 'Chup', which is based on a serial killer who kills critics for giving negative reviews.

146.title: Byju's to push IPO by 9-12 months over macroeconomic factors
146.article_body: Byju's, which was planning a public share listing in US, said that it would have to push its Initial Public Offering (IPO) by 9-12 months over macroeconomic factors. Byju's reported a ₹4,588 crore loss in FY21, nearly 17 times the ₹262 crore loss in FY20. Byju Raveendran, Co-founder and CEO, said the company will be cash-flow positive by March 2023.

147.title: Robin Uthappa retires from all forms of Indian cricket
147.article_body: Cricketer Robin Uthappa on Wednesday announced his retirement from all forms of Indian cricket. The 36-year-old shared a note on social media, writing, "It has been my greatest honour to represent my country and my state, Karnataka. However, all good things must come to an end." Uthappa played 46 ODIs and 13 T20Is for India, scoring 1,183 runs.

148.title: PM Narendra Modi meets Bhutan King in Delhi
148.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Bhutan King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck on Wednesday in Delhi. "Discussed various ideas to further strengthen the close and unique India-Bhutan friendship," PM Modi tweeted as he shared pictures from the meeting. Wangchuck also met Foreign Secretary Vinay Mohan Kwatra. He was in India en route to London to attend Queen Elizabeth II's funeral.

149.title: 30 Indians rescued in Myanmar after being cheated in job scam: Report
149.article_body: The Indian Embassy in Myanmar has reportedly rescued over 30 Indians trapped in the country's Myawaddy area after they were cheated in a job scam. The victims were reportedly promised jobs in Thailand but were taken to Myanmar. "There are [ongoing] efforts [to] rescue...Indians...[as] the area isn't fully under the local authorities' control," a person familiar with the matter said.

150.title: iPhone 13 speculated to be under ₹50k during Big Billion Days: Flipkart
150.article_body: In the lead up to The Big Billion Days, Flipkart has indicated that the iPhone 13 will be available under ₹50,000 during the sale- 25% lower than the current price. Flipkart suggests that the iPhone 12 mini and iPhone 11 will also be available under ₹40,000 and ₹30,000 respectively. Big Billion Days Sale starts on 23rd September.

151.title: Yash Chopra offered me 'Chandni', I regret not doing it: Anil Kapoor
151.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor took to Twitter after Rishi Kapoor and Sridevi-starrer 'Chandni' completed 33 years on Wednesday. He tweeted, "33 years of 'Chandni', a film which Yash Chopra offered me but I regret not doing it...Sridevi ji, Rishi ji, Vinod ji and Yash ji we...miss you all so much." Anil, who recently featured in 'JugJugg Jeeyo', will feature in 'Animal'.

152.title: In your 30s, you are not single, you are unmarried: Shriya Pilgaonkar
152.article_body: Actress Shriya Pilgaonkar believes when a woman reaches a certain age, external pressure and unnecessary jibes start coming at her. "In your 30s, you're not single, you're unmarried!" she said. "Often you end up questioning yourself...But I think it's better to take your time with it rather than it collapsing eventually...There's no fixed timeline to settling down," Shriya added.

153.title: If 1 TMC supporter is attacked, 2 of BJP will be thrashed: WB Minister
153.article_body: TMC workers are not "wearing bangles" and if one of them is attacked, then two of BJP will be thrashed, West Bengal Minister Udayan Guha said. The BJP said that such statements are quite expected from TMC leaders who speak the "language of lumpen". TMC is making such statements out of frustration, BJP state spokesperson Samik Bhattacharya said.

154.title: Independent agency selected Guj for semiconductor plant: Vedanta Chairman
154.article_body: An independent agency, along with Taiwan's Foxconn, had selected Gujarat as a conducive location for setting up a display fabrication and semiconductor facility, Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal said on Wednesday. "We also had two other consultants as experts and they have been working for the last one-and-a-half month," Agarwal said. Gujarat plant's funding would come from Vedanta, he added.

155.title: It's Congress' fault too: Kejriwal on 8 Congress MLAs joining BJP in Goa
155.article_body: AAP's Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday reacted to eight Congress MLAs, including ex-Goa CM Digambar Kamat, joining BJP in Goa, claiming that Congress is also to blame for the situation. "[BJP] couldn't break our MLAs in Delhi-Punjab because we expose them, but Congress has failed to save its MLAs," he said. BJP is poaching MLAs everywhere under 'Operation Lotus', he added.

156.title: Indrani Mukerjea's daughter seeks court permit to hug her mother
156.article_body: The daughter of Indrani Mukerjea, Vidhie Mukerjea, appeared before a special court in Mumbai on Wednesday, seeking oral permission for a hug from her mother. Vidhie, in a plea, that the special court rejected, had said that she had been deprived of her mother's companionship, love and warmth since her arrest and hadn't been with her for seven years.

157.title: Science could uncover alien life within 25 years: Swiss scientist
157.article_body: Swiss astrophysicist Sascha Quanz said science might uncover evidence of alien life in the next 25 years. Quanz said new technology under development at ETH Zurich, Switzerland's federal technology institute, along with existing technologies such as James Webb Space Telescope and progress in science, could lead humanity to uncover evidence of life outside our solar system.

158.title: Part of under-construction railway tunnel collapses in Odisha, 2 killed
158.article_body: Two labourers were killed after a part of an under-construction railway tunnel collapsed in Odisha's Koraput district on Wednesday, police said. The deceased were identified as Rabi Pepeka, a local, and Joharuddin, a resident of Assam. The two labourers were rescued and rushed to a hospital, but they were declared brought dead, police added.

159.title: Breath analyser test to resume for all airline crew from Oct 15
159.article_body: Aviation regulator Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has issued guidelines to resume breath analyser tests for pilots and cabin crew from October 15. It said the decision has been taken in view of falling COVID-19 cases and an increase in the volume of air traffic. Breath analyser test was limited to 50% of the aircraft personnel during the pandemic.

160.title: Kartavya Path to have 90 ice cream carts, 30 water vending machines: NDMC
160.article_body: Newly christened Kartavya Path will have 90 ice cream carts and 30 water vending machines at six vending locations, NDMC said on Wednesday. "Each vending zone can have a maximum of 15 ice cream trolleys and five water dispensing kiosks," said New Delhi Municipal Council Vice Chairman Satish Upadhyay. This is for effective management of kiosks, he added.

161.title: Taxi and autorickshaw strike called off in Mumbai
161.article_body: The autorickshaw and taxi strike, scheduled to take place in Mumbai from September 15, has been called off for now, Mumbai Taximen's Union leader AL Quadros said. This comes after union leaders met state Industries Minister Uday Samant. Quadros said that Samant assured the leaders that a decision on their demands including fare hikes would be taken within 10 days.

162.title: India responds to Islamic group's remarks on J&K, says 'factually incorrect references'
162.article_body: India rejected "factually incorrect" references on J&K in a recent statement by Organisation of Islamic Cooperation and denounced Pakistan's attempts to use the platform against India. Accusing Pakistan of "peddling malicious propaganda", India said Islamabad is "well-advised to put its own house in order". "Pakistan has abysmal record on...protection of human rights of its people," India added.

163.title: WhatsApp releases ability to hide 'online' status to some beta users: Report
163.article_body: WhatsApp is releasing the ability to hide 'online' status for some beta users through the Android 2.22.20.9 update, WABetaInfo reported. The feature can be accessed through the 'Privacy' section under 'Account' settings. Users will get the option of making their 'online' status visible to everyone or to those contacts who can see the user's 'last seen' status.

164.title: Woman,13-yr-old son found hanging in B'luru, police suspect suicide
164.article_body: A 48-year-old woman and her 13-year-old son were found dead at their house in Karnataka's Hosaguddadahalli. The information was received around 2:15 pm at the limits of Byatarayanapura police station, said Laxman B Nimbargi, DCP, West Bengaluru. The DCP added that the reason for the "suicide" is yet to be ascertained and they are looking into the matter.

165.title: Delhi govt school staffers assault DD News journalist, break camera
165.article_body: An FIR has been registered against staffers of a Delhi government school after a DD News journalist alleged that he and his colleagues were assaulted and their camera was broken at the school. A case has also been registered on the complaint of a school teacher, who alleged that the journalist forcefully entered the school and assaulted staffers, police said.

166.title: Bengaluru Police seize 506 kg of ganja valued at over ₹2 crore
166.article_body: Bengaluru Police have seized 506 kg of ganja, worth over ₹2 crore, after receiving a tip-off, officials said. The contraband was seized earlier in the week near the Kempambudhi Lake in south Bengaluru after officials received information that a drug consignment from Malkangiri region of Odisha had reached the city. Five persons have been arrested in the case.

167.title: Latest T20I team rankings announced, India remain on top
167.article_body: The ICC today released the latest men's T20I team rankings, with India remaining on top with 268 rating points. Meanwhile, Pakistan, who lost the Asia Cup 2022 final to Sri Lanka, have slipped to the fourth position from the second position. Asia Cup 2022 winners Sri Lanka are ranked eighth with 237 rating points.

168.title: Scene I shared with Irrfan in 'Angrezi...' is precious to me: Pankaj
168.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi has said that late actor Irrfan Khan inspired him to become an actor. "Irrfan sahab was very dear to me...That one sequence that I shared with him in 'Angrezi Medium' is very precious to me," he added. 'Angrezi Medium' was Irrfan's last film. Pankaj recently featured in 'Sherdil: The Pilibhit Saga'.

169.title: Earth barrelling towards uncharted territory of destruction: WMO report
169.article_body: Citing a report by World Meteorological Organization, UN chief António Guterres said climate change is leading "Earth towards uncharted territory of destruction". Weather, climate, and water-related disasters have increased by a factor of 5 over 50 years, the report stated. Europe's heatwave, Pakistan's floods and China's droughts are the price of humanity's fossil fuel addiction, Guterres said.

170.title: I've hardly slept in the last six months: Byju's CEO on company's troubles
170.article_body: Byju Raveendran, the Co-founder and CEO of India's most valued edtech startup Byju's, told Moneycontrol, "The last six months have been tough, like I've hardly slept." His statement comes after questions were raised over the company's aggressive sales practices, delay in its FY21 annual report and layoffs. "It can't be tougher than this," he added.

171.title: Few passengers injured as smoke emerged from Express flight in Muscat: Air India
171.article_body: Air India said some of the 145 passengers on board its Express flight to Kochi suffered minor bruises during the evacuation process after smoke started coming out of the plane at Muscat International Airport on Wednesday. The airline, however, added that no major injuries were reported. The passengers included four infants.

172.title: Will you fire his also: Assam CM to Congress over Nehru's pic in shorts
172.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Tuesday shared an image of former PM Jawaharlal Nehru wearing shorts and captioned it, "Will you fire his also..." This comes after Congress on Monday shared an image of a pair of khaki shorts on fire. Nehru, however, is not wearing the RSS khaki shorts but the uniform of Congress' Seva Dal.

173.title: Fear has returned to Bihar, there's mis-governance: BJP on Begusarai firing
173.article_body: BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad on Wednesday criticised Bihar CM Nitish Kumar over firing in Begusarai and said that fear has returned to the state, adding that there's mis-governance. Prasad alleged that everyone, including investors, is unhappy with the state of affairs there. "What has happened to you Nitish Kumar ji in the company of your new friends," Prasad said.

174.title: 7 policemen suspended after mass shooting in Bihar's Begusarai
