While two dogs were seriously injured, they took away the body of the third and dumped it at an unknown location.

349.title: IPS officer who probed Ishrat Jahan encounter dismissed, HC stays order till Sept 19
349.article_body: Satish Chandra Verma, an IPS officer who had assisted CBI in its investigation into the Ishrat Jahan encounter case in Gujarat, was dismissed from the service on August 30. Delhi High Court, while hearing Verma's plea, has stayed the dismissal order till September 19. Verma was charged with "interacting with media" when he was a chief vigilance officer in Shillong.

350.title: 2 Pune policemen booked for abetment to suicide of 50-year-old man
350.article_body: Two officers of Pune City Police were among three persons booked for allegedly abetting suicide of a 50-year-old man. The victim, Rajendra Raut, was found hanging at his house on Monday. He was said to be facing harassment over a defaulted loan taken by his friend, for which he was the guarantor. Raut's daughter named two officers in an FIR.

351.title: Mandhana smashes 79*(53) to help India register 8-wicket win over England
351.article_body: India Women opener Smriti Mandhana scored an unbeaten 79-run innings off 53 balls to help her side register an eight-wicket win over England in the second T20I. India chased down England's 143-run target with 20 balls to spare to level the three-match series 1-1. The third and final match of the T20I series will be played on Thursday night.

352.title: Traffic curbs imposed in Bengaluru's Frazer Town today
352.article_body: The Bengaluru Traffic Police have put traffic restrictions in Bengaluru's Frazer Town area today (September 14)  in view of the work of laying an additional railway track to the existing railway track lane near Pottery Road and Clarence Junction. As per the advisory, the movement of all types of vehicles is restricted on the Railway bridge of Clarence Junction.

353.title: Queen Elizabeth's coffin arrives at Buckingham Palace in London, pic goes viral
353.article_body: The coffin of the late Queen Elizabeth has arrived at Buckingham Palace as tens of thousands of people lined the streets in heavy rain to mark its arrival in London. King Charles and members of the royal family received the coffin at the palace. Queen Elizabeth died at Balmoral Castle in the Scottish Highlands at the age of 96.

354.title: Sachin shares video of his special method to clean bat grip, criticised for wasting water
354.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar shared a video of himself on Instagram showing him cleaning bat grip using soap and tap water. Calling it his "special method", Sachin said nobody taught him the style and added it's his "gut feeling". However, fans pointed out running tap in the video and criticised him for wasting water. "Sir...what happened to save water," a fan wrote.

355.title: Mumbai to get 227 free healthcare centres under BMC: Maha CM Shinde
355.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Tuesday announced that 227 free healthcare centres will be set up across Mumbai under the 'Hindu Hriday Samrat Balasaheb Thackeray' dispensary from October 2. The centres will function under the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) and conduct 139 medical tests free of charge, officials said. Around 50 centres would be launched in the first phase.

356.title: My tweets are being suppressed: Musk as Twitter shareholders approve $44 bn buyout
356.article_body: Tagging Twitter and its CEO Parag Agrawal, the world's richest person Elon Musk on Tuesday tweeted, "My tweets are being suppressed!" and asked them to fix the issue. On Tuesday, Twitter shareholders also approved the $44 billion buyout deal proposed by Musk. The company has sued Musk for terminating the agreement, the trial for which begins on October 17.

357.title: Prince Harry responds after being banned from wearing military uniform at Queen vigil
357.article_body: After he was banned from wearing military uniform at Queen vigil, Prince Harry said that he will wear a morning suit throughout events honouring his grandmother. "His decade of military service is not determined by the uniform he wears and we respectfully ask that focus remain on the life and legacy of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II," Harry's spokesperson said.

358.title: Drunk auto driver assaults Mumbai traffic policeman over e-challans
358.article_body: An autorickshaw driver allegedly assaulted a traffic policeman on duty on Monday in Mumbai. According to police, he appeared to be drunk and has received more than 30 e-challans in the last two years. "[The driver] started screaming about unnecessary e-challans issued by traffic police and verbally abused me for fining drivers," said the traffic policeman.

359.title: 65-year-old woman found dead at home in Pune; cash, jewellery missing
359.article_body: A 65-year-old woman was found dead, with injuries inflicted by a sharp weapon, at her home in Pune's Warje area on Tuesday evening, police said. Some cash and jewellery from the house were missing, police added. "Injuries were inflicted on her neck and hand because of which she is suspected to have bled to her death," police further said.

360.title: Man dies as scooty collides with DTC bus in Delhi, driver arrested
360.article_body: A man, aged about 30-35 years, died after his scooty met with an accident with a Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) bus in the Punjabi Bagh area, police said. The accident happened on Tuesday evening and the victim died on the spot, police added. The 32-year-old bus driver was apprehended and the vehicle has been seized, DCP (West) Ghanshyam Bansal said.

361.title: NBA team owner Sarver suspended for 1 year, fined $10 million for workplace misconduct
361.article_body: Robert Sarver, owner of NBA's Phoenix Suns and WNBA's Phoenix Mercury, has been suspended for one year and fined $10 million by NBA for workplace misconduct. The NBA said that its investigation found that Sarver at times showed "inequitable conduct toward female employees", including "sex-related comments" and "inappropriate comments on employees' appearances".

362.title: Qatar's WC test sees water running out, emergency personnel stranded
362.article_body: Qatar's new Lusail Stadium, which will host football World Cup matches in November, ran a near-capacity test which reportedly saw long lines and stands running out of water by halftime. The 80,000-seat stadium, which will also host the final, reportedly had security and medical staff finding stadium access difficult. Organisers say they gained "invaluable experience" ahead of the tournament.

363.title: 17 get life imprisonment in 28-year-old double-murder case
363.article_body: As many as 17 people were awarded life imprisonment by a court in UP's Hamirpur on Tuesday in a 28-year-old double-murder case. The case pertained to the murder of Jaswant and Motilal on March 15, 1994. Of the 25 people originally accused of killing the duo, five died during the course of the trial while three others are still absconding.

364.title: Mexican drug lord jailed for killing US agent granted house arrest
364.article_body: The co-founder of Mexico's Guadalajara drug cartel, Miguel Angel Felix Gallardo, has been granted house arrest by a district judge after three decades in jail, prosecutors said on Monday. Gallardo, who is now 76 years old, was imprisoned in 1989 for the murder of a US Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) agent. Felix Gallardo is reportedly in poor health.

365.title: Gangster Lakhbir Landa's aide arrested in Punjab, 103-g heroin seized
365.article_body: Anmoldeep Soni, aide of Canada-based gangster Lakhbir Singh Landa, has been arrested in Punjab's Kharar, police said on Tuesday. Police recovered 103-gram heroin from his possession. Police said he is a member of the Landa module which was instrumental in the delivery of militant hardware and narcotics. Landa had conspired in the terror attack at Punjab Police Intelligence office, Mohali.

366.title: Siraj takes 5-wicket haul for Warwickshire in county cricket debut
366.article_body: Pacer Mohammed Siraj took five wickets for 82 runs in 24 overs as he helped Warwickshire bowl out Somerset for 219 on his county cricket debut. Pakistan opener Imam Ul Haq, George Bartlett, James Rew, Lewis Gregory and Josh Davey were the batters that fell to the pacer. Siraj has not been selected in India's T20 World Cup squad.

367.title: PSG looking to extend Lionel Messi's contract by 2 more years: Report
367.article_body: Ligue 1 club PSG are reportedly looking to extend Lionel Messi's contract by two more years as his current agreement expires next year. A report says fresh talks are unlikely to happen until after the 2022 FIFA World Cup. Messi has scored four goals and has made seven assists in nine games this season.

368.title: Resolve issues delaying peace process: Govt to Nagaland lawmakers
368.article_body: The Centre asked the Nagaland lawmakers' panel, led by Chief Minister Neiphiu Rio, to resolve the remaining core issues delaying the Naga peace process. Union Home Minister Amit Shah met with 11 members of the panel, seeking a final solution before the state assembly polls due next year. Rio said they urged for an honourable and early solution.

369.title: Right to contest elections not a fundamental right: Supreme Court
369.article_body: Observing that the right to contest elections is neither a fundamental nor a common law right, the Supreme Court imposed a cost of ₹1 lakh on a litigant. The litigant was seeking to contest the Rajya Sabha polls without a proposer to propose his name. "It (right to contest polls) is a right conferred by a statute", the bench said.

370.title: Assam to demarcate Army firing range in Tamulpur: CM Sarma
370.article_body: The Assam government has decided to demarcate an Army firing range in Tamulpur district, Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said. He added that this is being done to reduce incidents of injury or death and damage to property in the test firings. The government is looking into providing financial assistance to families previously affected by this.

371.title: Twitter shareholders approve Elon Musk's $44-billion bid to buy company
371.article_body: Twitter shareholders on Tuesday approved Elon Musk’s $44-billion bid to buy the social media platform. Twitter said that the measure passed based on a preliminary count, adding that it will provide a final vote count to shareholders at a later date. Musk in July announced that he was calling off his bid to buy the firm.

372.title: May miss Shami's pace at some stage of T20 WC: Ex-chief selector Prasad
372.article_body: Former BCCI chief selector MSK Prasad said the squad for the T20 World Cup 2022 seems balanced but may miss Mohammad Shami's pace at some stage. He added that post the tournament, players like Sanju Samson, Ravi Bishnoi and Ishan Kishan may get more chances. He also backed Rohit Sharma, KL Rahul and Virat Kohli for the top-three batting slots.

373.title: Ram Temple's 1-month-long grand opening to begin from Jan 14-15, 2024: Trust
373.article_body: The one-month-long grand opening of Ayodhya's Ram Mandir will begin from January 14-15, 2024, Shri Ram Janmbhoomi Teerth Kshetra Trust General Secretary Champat Rai said. He added that the temple's construction would be completed by end of 2023. Construction of six other structures inside the Janmbhoomi complex would also be completed by December 2023, he added.

374.title: Missing Uttarakhand's Champawat SDM found in Shimla
374.article_body: Uttarakhand's Champawat SDM Anil Chanyal, who had gone missing on Monday, was found in Shimla on Tuesday. Champawat District Magistrate Narendra Bhandari spoke to the SDM over the phone and said he was likely to return soon. Notably, Chanyal was reported missing by a home guard in his security detail. According to PTI, Chanyal had been stressed for some time.

375.title: Priyanka cried after she was offered a negative role in 'Aitraaz': Suneel Darshan
375.article_body: Producer Suneel Darshan revealed that Priyanka Chopra had cried after she was offered a negative character in 'Aitraaz'. "She was so upset, she cried, she went home and she went to sleep," he added. "I said after you wake up come back to the office...I pressed on her...the importance of...doing the role," Suneel further said.

376.title: It's tricky but I want Suryakumar at number 3: Rohan Gavaskar
376.article_body: Former Indian cricketer Rohan Gavaskar has commented on the Indian T20I team's batting order for games in the upcoming ICC T20 World Cup in Australia. "Suryakumar Yadav at number three [is] a pleasing thought. But Virat...showed what a tremendous success he is as an opener. It means KL Rahul will have to make way...It's one of those tricky...situations," Rohan said.

377.title: Queen Elizabeth's lookalike to retire after 34 years 'out of respect' for monarch
377.article_body: The late Queen Elizabeth II's 89-year-old lookalike Mary Reynolds has said she will stop impersonating the British monarch "out of respect" for her after her death. Reynolds has played the Queen in films and on television. Her most notable portrayal of Queen Elizabeth was in the 1990 comedy film 'Bullseye!'. She has also featured in a 'Doctor Who' episode.

378.title: Saw evidence of my wife cheating on me, couldn't sleep anymore: Ex-Italy footballer Totti
378.article_body: Talking about separating from his wife Ilary Blasi in July this year, World Cup-winning former Italy footballer Francesco Totti said that he couldn't sleep after seeing evidence of Blasi cheating on him on her mobile phone. He added, "That led to depression. I couldn't sleep anymore. I pretended nothing was wrong, but I was no longer me...I was someone else."

379.title: Dulquer can be a terrific discovery for other half of country: Balki on Chup
379.article_body: Filmmaker R Balki opened up about casting Dulquer Salmaan in his upcoming thriller 'Chup'. He said, "I was lucky to have someone super talented, a superstar in one half of the country, who speaks Hindi as if it's his mother tongue and who can be a terrific discovery for...other half of...country." Dulquer predominantly works in Malayalam and Tamil language films.

380.title: Himachal CM lays foundation stone for projects worth ₹42 cr in Palampur
380.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur on Tuesday laid the foundation stone for 17 developmental projects worth ₹42 crore in Kangra district's Palampur. "Himachal Pradesh has...made immense progress in all spheres of development during these 75 years," Thakur said. The literacy rate at the formation of the state was 4.8%, whereas today, the literacy rate has crossed 83%, he added.

381.title: Former Kerala minister & Janata Dal leader NM Joseph dies aged 79
381.article_body: Former Kerala Forest Minister NM Joseph passed away on Tuesday at the age of 79, his family said. Joseph served as the state Forest Minister from 1987 to 1991 and also worked as a professor of economics at the St Thomas College in Pala. He also served as Janata Dal's national vice-president. Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan condoled his demise.

382.title: EC delists 86 'non-existent' unrecognised political parties
382.article_body: The Election Commission of India on Tuesday delisted 86 Registered Unrecognised Political Parties (RUPP) that were found to be non-existent. Further, it declared 253 RUPPs as 'inactive', noting that they've not contested a single election either to the state general Assembly or the Parliament election 2014 and 2019. The EC barred these parties from availing benefits of Elections Symbol Order.

383.title: Queen Elizabeth II's coffin was made over 3 decades ago: Report
383.article_body: Queen Elizabeth II's coffin will lie in state in London for four days ahead of her funeral on September 19. The English oak coffin is said to be crafted at least 32 years ago, AFP reported. It's lined with lead in accordance with royal family customs. The lead lining assists the body to last longer after burial in a crypt.

384.title: Diego Costa joins PL club Wolves, video of announcement with real wolves goes viral
384.article_body: Former Chelsea and Atlético Madrid forward Diego Costa has joined Premier League club Wolverhampton Wanderers (Wolves), with the club releasing an announcement video of the footballer with real wolves. Talking about the viral video, the 33-year-old footballer said, "I was scared to death. Holding that chain I kept thinking, 'What if this wolf thinks about jumping on top of me?'"

385.title: How can you already decide he'll go for runs: Gavaskar to fan over Harshal's selection
385.article_body: During a question-answer session conducted by 'Sports Tak', a fan questioned Harshal Patel's selection in India's T20 World Cup squad, saying he would go for runs as he bowls slow. Sunil Gavaskar responded, "We will see that once the tournament starts. How can you already decide that he will go for runs? Let the match happen first."

386.title: She's showing off her growth in greatness: Roddick on world no. 1 Swiatek
386.article_body: Andy Roddick praised Iga Swiatek following her US Open win, saying the world number one is showing off her growth in greatness. "Conditions/balls she wasn't a massive fan of...not having had her best stuff coming into this Slam. Still problem solved," he added. Swiatek has won seven titles in 2022, the most by a woman since Serena Williams in 2014.

387.title: Kohli is great option as opener for India in T20Is: Rohan Gavaskar
387.article_body: Former Indian cricketer Rohan Gavaskar said that batter Virat Kohli is a "great option" as an opener for India in T20Is. "You look at his (Kohli) T20 numbers, they are outstanding. He averages about 55-57 and his strike rate is about 160," Rohan said. He added, "His last innings, again unbeaten innings of 122, tells you that he...relishes opening."

388.title: Prefer dynastic rule over current autocracy, dictatorship: Shiv Sena
388.article_body: The Shiv Sena, through its mouthpiece 'Saamana', said "a dynastic rule would seem preferable" to the "autocracy and dictatorship" in the country. They also praised the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and said the questions raised by Rahul Gandhi seem to "have shut BJP's mouth". It added that the 'yatra' will "repair the atmosphere of hatred" prevailing in the country.

389.title: Thackeray's supporters sprinkle cow urine after Maha CM's event; video surfaces
389.article_body: A video showing supporters of former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray sprinkling cow urine using lemon leaves at the venue of Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde's event in Aurangabad has surfaced on social media. Maharashtra Legislative Council Leader of Opposition Ambadas Danve, part of Thackeray-led Shiv Sena, earlier said cow urine was poured to purify the road after Shinde passed through it.

390.title: Ban breeding and keeping of dogs like Pitbulls: PETA to Centre
390.article_body: PETA has written to the Centre asking for a ban on the breeding, selling and keeping of dogs like Pitbulls, which are bred for fighting and racing. "For those (Pitbulls) that are already at home, they need to be registered and sterilised," said PETA. The group also said that such dogs are used for fighting, leading to physical mutilations.

391.title: Inflation not a 'red-letter priority' for FM Sitharaman: Chidambaram
391.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Tuesday criticised Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman over the rise of the inflation rate to 7% in August. Chidambaram said, "Only a few days ago, the Honourable FM said...inflation wasn't a 'red-lettered priority' for her." "If [Sitharaman] doesn't see 'red' even now, we can...conclude that she doesn't represent the average family in India," Chidambaram added.

392.title: CCI rejects complaints against PVR-INOX proposed deal
392.article_body: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) rejected a complaint against the proposed merger of PVR and INOX Leisure. The CCI said that apprehension of the likelihood of the anti-competitive practices cannot be subjected to inquiry. A complaint was filed by non-profit group CUTS stating that the proposed deal will have anti-competitive effects on the industry and demanded a detailed probe.

393.title: 'I can't bear this bloody thing,' says King Charles as he gets frustrated at leaky pen
393.article_body: A video shows King Charles getting frustrated at a leaky pen on Tuesday during a signing ceremony in Northern Ireland. "Oh god I hate this (pen)!" King Charles said, standing up and handing the pen to his wife and Queen Consort Camilla. "I can't bear this bloody thing...every stinking time," Charles stated as he walked away.

394.title: Ayushmann, Rakul's 'Doctor G' to release on Oct 14: Report
394.article_body: Ayushmann Khurrana and Rakul Preet Singh-starrer 'Doctor G' is set to release on October 14, according to a report. As per a source quoted by Pinkvilla, the date will enable the film to get a clear run of 11 days until the release of Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Ram Setu' and Ajay Devgn's 'Thank God'. 'Doctor G' also stars Shefali Shah.

395.title: Arshdeep messaged me he isn't bothered about trolls: Childhood coach Rai
395.article_body: Commenting on trolling and criticism faced by India pacer Arshdeep Singh after he dropped a catch against Pakistan in Asia Cup 2022, his childhood coach Jaswant Rai said, "He also sent me a message that he is not bothered." He added, "He was, in fact, upset because he conceded a boundary versus Pakistan. He was dejected because of that boundary."

396.title: Concerned about Russia aggravating Azerbaijan-Armenia conflict: US
396.article_body: The US is concerned that Russia could try to aggravate the situation arising out of the latest fighting between Azerbaijan and Armenia, U.S. State Secretary Antony Blinken said on Tuesday. He added that Washington is "always" apprehensive about Moscow exploiting such events to divert attention from the conflict in Ukraine. Armenia has reported losing 49 soldiers in the renewed fighting.

397.title: Who are the top 10 men's tennis players as latest rankings released?
397.article_body: US Open 2022 winner Carlos Alcaraz, aged 19, has become the youngest male tennis player to become world number one. US Open 2022 runner-up Casper Ruud has jumped to the second position, while Daniil Medvedev has slipped three spots to the fourth position. Rafael Nadal remains at the third position, while Novak Djokovic dropped one spot to be ranked 7th.

398.title: Not answerable to anybody: Nisha on 'extramarital affair' accusation
398.article_body: Actress Nisha Rawal has reacted after her estranged husband Karan Mehra accused her of having an extramarital affair with a man named Rohit Satia. She said that she's "not answerable" to anyone. "After...breakup, what I do in my personal life, it's none of his business and what he does in his personal life is none of my business," Nisha added.

399.title: 'Nabanna Cholo' has rattled the corrupt, power-drunk in WB: Pradhan
399.article_body: Speaking about BJP's 'Nabanna Cholo' march, Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Tuesday said the protest march has rattled the corrupt and power-drunk in West Bengal. The state has risen to reclaim its glory, he added. "West Bengal has risen against anarchy, corruption and murder of democracy. No amount of muscle-flexing and state-sponsored violence will mute people's voices," Pradhan said.

400.title: Shudras will be insulted till they remain Hindus: DMK's A Raja
400.article_body: DMK leader A Raja reportedly said that Shudras were 'insulted' and 'denied equality' in Manusmriti and it would continue to happen till they 'remain Hindus'. "You are the son of a prostitute...a Panchaman (Dalit)...an untouchable till you remain a Hindu," Raja allegedly said. He also reportedly asked if "there (is) any other country meting out such cruelty?"

401.title: PM Modi to unveil National Logistics Policy on Sept 17
401.article_body: The National Logistics Policy will be released by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on September 17, Union Minister of Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal said on Tuesday. The policy is aimed at facilitating the seamless movement of goods across India, the minister added. The policy's introduction was announced by the central government during the presentation of the Union Budget 2020-21.
